definition: to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: If your face is oval , keep your hairstyle simple and neat.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是鸡蛋脸，你的发型就要是简单而俐落的。

sentences.english: She slipped the ring from her finger.
sentences.chinese: 她俐落地从手指上取下戒指。

sentences.english: His hands are really so neat, only one afternoon Kung Fu?
sentences.chinese: 他手脚真的那么俐落，才一下午功夫？

sentences.english: The plumber did a clean job.
sentences.chinese: 这水管工人的手脚很俐落。

sentences.english: Cut metals in a clean way and fast.
sentences.chinese: 快速地切割金属，干净俐落。

sentences.english: Leave No Trace, removed after the restore hair, convenient and tidy.
sentences.chinese: 不留痕迹，撕下后还原发型，方便俐落。

sentences.english: I became as neat at ending liaisons as at starting them.
sentences.chinese: 结束关系时，就跟开始的时候一样干净俐落。

definition: to catch and hold on/to continue/to go on to do sth/to follow/to carry on/then/after that/subsequently/to proceed/to ensue/in turn/in one's turn
the rear/far behind the front line
